Class PatternUtils

extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for creating and manipulating csv column-value patterns

    • Method Detail

      • createCsvColumnPatternFromString

        public static java.lang.String createCsvColumnPatternFromString(java.lang.String s)
        Create a pattern for a given string Examples: 1. "abc" = [LETTERS] 2. "bio101" = [LETTERS, DIGITS] 3. "SO:3347" = [LETTERS, SYMBOL, DIGITS] 4. "amino-acid (RNA)" = [LETTERS] symbols between text(string) are not considered Skip commonly used text symbols (such as ',', '(', ')', etc), if it is between two string text. Example where symbols will be skipped: 1. "Hi, deer" = skip ',' 2. "United State(US)" = skip '(', ')' as both are part of text 3. "region & mRNA" = skip '&' 4. "1234-abc" = '-' won't be skipped, because it's not between two string
        Parameters:
        s - a string
        Returns:
        CsvColumnPattern

      • serializePatternList

        public static java.lang.String serializePatternList(java.util.List<CsvColumnValueType> pattern)
        Serialize a list of CsvColumnValueType(representing a pattern) into a string
        Parameters:
        pattern - list CsvColumnValueType
        Returns:
        serialized string version of the pattern

      • deSerializePatternList

        public static java.util.List<CsvColumnValueType> deSerializePatternList(java.lang.String serializedPattern)
        De-Serialize a serialized string pattern into a list of list of CsvColumnValueType(representing a pattern)
        Parameters:
        serializedPattern - serialized pattern string
        Returns:
        list of CsvColumnValueType(representing a pattern)

      • compressRepeatedPatterns

        public static java.lang.String compressRepeatedPatterns(java.lang.String patternStr)
        Replace repeated patterns in string to single occurrence, it replace consecutive repeated pattern in a string to its single occurrence Example : 1. "AAAAAAB" = "AB" 2. "ABAB" = "AB" 3. "ABCXYZABCXYZ" = "ABCXYZ"
        Parameters:
        patternStr - string to compress
        Returns:
        compressed string with replaced repeated pattern with single occurrence
